metadata.title: CVE-2022-30522 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
If Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 is configured to do transformations with mod_sed in contexts where the input to mod_sed may be very large, mod_sed may make excessively large memory allocations and trigger an abort.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-bin - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-data - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-utils - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.54-2ubuntu1').
